column2: Having the distinction of being NATO's doctrine in the latter part of the 20th Century, Air-Land Battle relies on swift operations and cooperation between the military branches to achieve military goals.

Serving as the military doctrine for the Warsaw Pact countries, Deep Battle relies on striking deep within the enemy's lands, as well as letting the enemy tire themselves across multiple layers of your own defense. In essence, it focuses on the 'depth' of the battlefield.

Developed through years by a myriad of popular insurrections, and eventually codified and refined by Maoist forces and other revolutionary groups, the People's War entails mobilizing the general population for war as effective forces against the enemy.
We have recently reorganized our armed forces to switch between doctrines. Due to retraining and refitting, it will take some time until we are at full capability once more.
